page.title: 01WAPPENHAM VILLAGE AND PARISH
page.content: Houses built of brick or local stone. Most owner-occupied. No housing estate. Small quiet village, no pub. Amenities are* shop/post office, public telephone, village hall, mathodist chapel, C of E church. Vicar shared with other villages, milkman, butcher, fruiterer/greengrocer, fishmonger, newspapers call each week. Public utilities are sewage, water, electricity, no gas, no street lights, bus on market days only. Local farming raises beef, bamb, corn, potatoes, oilseed rape. 12 Farmers in the area, 6 farm cottages, but only 2 men from the village employed on the farms. Small specialist business making eye contact lenses employs 5 people from outside the area. 11 self-employed tradesmen, 7 self-employed executives, other employment is in local towns, 2 commute to London. Population 270 in
